article: If we were to keep a record of all the things we worried about during a given period of time we would discover in reviewing them that the great majority of our _ never come to pass. This means that most of the time we _ to worrying even the constructive kind that prompts us to try to come up with a _ to what is troubling us is wasted. _ we not only caused ourselves unnecessary mental pain but also _ valuable minutes and hours that could have been spent elsewhere.To _ this it is often necessary to subject potential _ of worry to the coldly objective. Once before a major _ in front of a standing-room-only audience a member of Arturo Toscanini s orchestra approached the great Italian conductor with a terrible _ on his face Maestro the musician said _ my instrument is not working _ I cannot reach the _ of E-flat Whatever will I do We are to _ a few moments later Toscanini looked with total _ at the man Then he _ kindly and placed an arm around his shoulders My friend the maestro replied do not worry about it The note E-flat does not _ anywhere in the music that you will be _ this evening The next time we find ourselves in the middle of _ about some matter we might be wise to _ and ask ourselves what the odds are of the problem really coming to _ .We may be able to go on to something more constructive 16
